page.title: 01Country near Condicote Lane
page.content: This rural area is situated between 165-235 metres up near Stow on the Wold on the Oolitic Limestone of the North Cotswold in the county of Gloucestershire. Quarrying that limestone is the only industry. Arable farming by affluent landowners is the main land coverage. Some animals are also kept. There are 5 farmhouses with workers' cottages. Houses no longer required for agricultural workers are now tenanted or let. Population is sparse and isolated. The Heythrop Foxhounds hunt over this country. Roads are narrow country lanes except for 2 km of the B4077. The ancient track running N-S is known as Condicote Lane. Tumuli and long barrows show evidence of man's previous occupation of the area.
